title: Making Edits
text: Things can update, : Function code folder R Function documentation folder R Package documentation folder vignettes Test cases folder tests Dependencies file DESCRIPTION Authors file DESCRIPTION Whenever update things, run commands check everything still working expected: steps, can push changes Github.
code: devtools::document() # Build files in man folder devtools::spell_check() # Check spelling (add false positives to inst/WORDLIST) urlchecker::url_check() # Check URLs devtools::test() # Execute tests from tests folder devtools::install() # Install as required by next command toscutil::check_pkg_docs() # Check function documentation for missing tags devtools::check() # Check package formalities pkgdown::build_site() # Build website in docs folder

title: Making Edits
text: Whenever package maintainer wants release new version package CRAN, : Check whether release requirements fulfilled Use following commands final check package release CRAN
code: # Check spelling and URLs. False positive findings of spell check should be # added to inst/WORDLIST. devtools::spell_check() urlchecker::url_check()  # Slower, but more realistic tests than devtools::check() rcmdcheck::rcmdcheck(args = c("--no-manual", "--as-cran"), build_args = ("--no-manual"), error_on = ("warning"), check_dir = "../toscutil-RCMDcheck") devtools::check(remote = TRUE, manual = TRUE, run_dont_test = TRUE)  # Check reverse dependencies. For details see: # https://r-pkgs.org/release.html#sec-release-revdep-checks # If revdepcheck is broken, follow the instructions at # https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/policies.html revdepcheck::revdep_check(num_workers = 8)  # Send your package to CRAN's builder services. You should receive an e-mail # within about 30 minutes with a link to the check results. Checking with # check_win_devel is required by CRAN policy and will (also) be done as part # of CRAN's incoming checks. devtools::check_win_oldrelease() devtools::check_win_release() devtools::check_win_devel() devtools::check_mac_release()  # Use the following command to submit the package to CRAN or submit via the web # interface available at https://cran.r-project.org/submit.html. devtools::submit_cran()

title: Authors and Citation
text: Tobias Schmidt. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Schmidt T (2026). toscutil: Utility Functions. R package version 2.10.0, https://github.com/toscm/toscutil/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {toscutil: Utility Functions},   author = {Tobias Schmidt},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 2.10.0},   url = {https://github.com/toscm/toscutil/}, }

title: Copilot Instructions for toscutil
text: Every new bugfix feature accompanied : 1. version increment according semantic versioning 2. corresponding description NEWS.md

title: Copilot Instructions for toscutil
text: Major version (x.0.0): Breaking changes Minor version (0.x.0): New features (backwards compatible) Patch version (0.0.x): Bug fixes (backwards compatible)

title: Copilot Instructions for toscutil
text: Indentation: Use 4 spaces indentation (tabs) Line length: Maximum 80 characters per line Simplicity: Code simple concise possible Dependencies: Use packages shipped standard R installation pipe operator: use pipe operator (%>% |>)

title: Copilot Instructions for toscutil
text: Keep code readable maintainable Follow existing code patterns repository Write clear documentation functions Add tests new features bug fixes

title: Utility Functions
text: Useful functions everyday programming.

title: Utility Functions
code: # From CRAN (stable version) install.packages("toscutil") # From Github (development version) devtools::install_github("toscm/toscutil")

title: Utility Functions
text: use function data object, first install package just enter object’s fully qualified name running R session, e.g. toscutil::now_ms(). can find curated list existing functions toscm.github.io/toscutil/reference. Alternatively, can load package first, using command library("toscutil") access symbol directly name, e.g. now_ms().

title: Utility Functions
text: details contribute package, please see CONTRIBUTING.md.

title: Docstring Template — DOCSTRING_TEMPLATE
text: minimal docstring template

title: Docstring Template — DOCSTRING_TEMPLATE
code: DOCSTRING_TEMPLATE

title: Docstring Template — DOCSTRING_TEMPLATE
text: single string, .e. character vector length 1.

title: Docstring Template — DOCSTRING_TEMPLATE
code: cat(DOCSTRING_TEMPLATE) #> #' @title TODO (e.g. 'Sum of Vector Elements') #> #' @description TODO (e.g. 'sum returns the sum of all the values present in its arguments.'

what: Get Name of Calling Function — caller
title: Get Name of Calling Function — caller
text: Returns name calling function string, .e. function g calls function f function f calls caller(2), string "g" returned.

title: Get Name of Calling Function — caller
code: caller(n = 1)

title: Get Name of Calling Function — caller
text: n many frames go call stack

title: Get Name of Calling Function — caller
text: Name calling function

title: Get Name of Calling Function — caller
text: careful using caller(n) input functions. Due R's non-standard-evaluation (NES) mechanism possible function executed directly function instead passed functions, .e. correct number frames go predicted priori. Solutions evaluate function first, store result variable pass variable function just try required number frames go interactive session. examples see section Examples.

title: Get Name of Calling Function — caller
code: # Here we want to return a list of all variables created inside a function f <- function(a = 1, b = 2) {     x <- 3     y <- 4     return(locals(without = formalArgs(caller(4))))     # We need to go 4 frames up, to catch the formalArgs of `f`, because the     # `caller(4)` argument is not evaluated directly be `formalArgs`. } f() # returns either list(x = 3, y = 4) or list(y = 4, x = 3) #> $y #> [1] 4 #>  #> $x #> [1] 3 #>   # The same result could have been achieved as follows g <- function(a = 1, b = 2) {     x <- 3     y <- 4     func <- caller(1)     return(locals(without = c("func", formalArgs(func)))) } g() # returns either list(x = 3, y = 4) or list(y = 4, x = 3) #> $y #> [1] 4 #>  #> $x #> [1] 3 #>

what: Capture output from a command — capture.output2
title: Capture output from a command — capture.output2
text: Like classic capture.output(), additional arguments collapse trim.

title: Capture output from a command — capture.output2
code: capture.output2(..., collapse = "\n", trim = FALSE)

title: Capture output from a command — capture.output2
text: ... Arguments passed capture.output(). collapse TRUE, lines collapsed single string. FALSE, lines returned . character, lines collapsed using character. trim TRUE, leading trailing whitespace line removed lines collapsed /returned.

title: Capture output from a command — capture.output2
text: collapse TRUE "\n", character vector length 1. Else, character vector length n, n corresponds number lines outputted expression passed capture.output().

title: Capture output from a command — capture.output2
code: x <- capture.output2(str(list(a = 1, b = 2, c = 1:3))) cat2(x) #> List of 3 #>  $ a: num 1 #>  $ b: num 2 #>  $ c: int [1:3] 1 2 3

title: Concatenate and Print — cat0
text: cat additional argument end, gets printed elements. Inspired pythons print command. Warning: function deprecated longer used. function guaranteed available part package end 2023 might removed time 31.12.2023.

title: Concatenate and Print — cat0
text: ... objects passed cat sep character vector strings append element end string print elements

title: Concatenate and Print — cat0
text: return value, called side effects

title: Concatenate and Print — cat0
code: cat0("hello", "world") # prints "helloworld" (without newline) #> Warning: This function is deprecated and should no longer be used. The function is guaranteed to be available as part of the package until 31.12.2023 but might be removed at any later timepoint. #> helloworld

title: Concatenate and Print — cat0n
text: cat additional argument end, gets printed elements. Inspired pythons print command. Warning: function deprecated longer used. function guaranteed available part package end 2023 might removed time 31.12.2023.

title: Concatenate and Print — cat0n
code: cat0n(..., sep = "", end = "\n")

title: Concatenate and Print — cat0n
text: ... objects passed cat sep character vector strings append element end string print elements

title: Concatenate and Print — cat0n
text: return value, called side effects

title: Concatenate and Print — cat0n
code: cat0n("hello", "world") # prints "helloworld\n" #> Warning: This function is deprecated and should no longer be used. The function is guaranteed to be available as part of the package until 31.12.2023 but might be removed at any later timepoint. #> helloworld

title: Concatenate and Print — cat2
text: base::cat() additional argument end, gets printed elements. Inspired pythons print command.

title: Concatenate and Print — cat2
code: cat2(   ...,   sep = " ",   end = "\n",   file = "",   append = FALSE,   fill = FALSE,   labels = NULL )

title: Concatenate and Print — cat2
text: ... R objects (see 'Details' types objects allowed). sep character vector strings append element. end string print elements. file connection, character string naming file print . "" (default), cat2 prints standard output connection, console unless redirected sink. append logical. used argument file name file (connection "|cmd"). TRUE output appended file; otherwise, overwrite contents file. fill logical (positive) numeric controlling output broken successive lines. FALSE (default), newlines created explicitly "\n" printed. Otherwise, output broken lines print width equal option width fill TRUE, value fill numeric. Linefeeds inserted elements, strings wider fill wrapped. Non-positive fill values ignored, warning. labels character vector labels lines printed. Ignored fill FALSE.

title: Concatenate and Print — cat2
text: return value, called side effects

title: Concatenate and Print — cat2
code:
x <- 1 cat("x:", x, "
") # prints 'Number: 1 
' (with a space between 1 and 
) #> x: 1  cat2("x:", x) # prints 'Number: 1
'  (without space) #> x: 1

title: Format and Print — catf
text: cat(sprintf(fmt, ...))

title: Format and Print — catf
code: catf(fmt, ..., file = "", append = FALSE, fill = FALSE, labels = NULL)

title: Format and Print — catf
text: fmt character vector format strings, 8192 bytes. ... 100 values passed fmt. logical, integer, real character vectors supported, coercion done: see Details section base::sprintf(). file connection, character string naming file print . "" (default), cat2 prints standard output connection, console unless redirected sink. append logical. used argument file name file (connection "|cmd"). TRUE output appended file; otherwise, overwrite contents file. fill logical (positive) numeric controlling output broken successive lines. FALSE (default), newlines created explicitly "\n" printed. Otherwise, output broken lines print width equal option width fill TRUE, value fill numeric. Linefeeds inserted elements, strings wider fill wrapped. Non-positive fill values ignored, warning. labels character vector labels lines printed. Ignored fill FALSE.

title: Format and Print — catf
text: return value, called side effects

title: Format and Print — catf
code: catf("A%dB%sC", 2, "asdf") # prints "A2BasdfC" #> A2BasdfC

what: Check Documented Functions in a Package — check_pkg_docs
title: Check Documented Functions in a Package — check_pkg_docs
text: Lists documented functions package checks documentation elements potential issues. following checks performed: Title present start regex "Function". Description present start "function". Value present. Example present.

title: Check Documented Functions in a Package — check_pkg_docs
code: check_pkg_docs(pkg = NULL, unload = TRUE, reload = TRUE)

title: Check Documented Functions in a Package — check_pkg_docs
text: pkg package name. NULL, package name inferred DESCRIPTION file current directory parent directory. DESCRIPTION file found, function stops error message. unload Whether try unload potential currently developed package using devtools::unload() checking documentation. Required package loaded devtools::load_all() documentation database exists installed packages. unloading fails, function silently continues, unloading necessary checking documentation currently developed packages. reload Whether reload package using devtools::load_all() checking documentation.

title: Check Documented Functions in a Package — check_pkg_docs
text: Returns dataframe columns title, description, value, examples rows corresponding documented functions package. cell contains string describing check result corresponding documentation element function.

title: Check Documented Functions in a Package — check_pkg_docs
code: df <- check_pkg_docs("tools") try(df <- check_pkg_docs())

what: Get Normalized Configuration Directory Path of a Program — config_dir
title: Get Normalized Configuration Directory Path of a Program — config_dir
text: config_dir returns absolute, normalized path configuration directory program/package/app based optional app-specific commandline argument, optional app-specific environment variable XDG Base Directory Specification

title: Get Normalized Configuration Directory Path of a Program — config_dir
code: config_dir(   app_name,   cl_arg = commandArgs()[grep("--config-dir", commandArgs()) + 1],   env_var = Sys.getenv(toupper(paste0(app_name, "_config_dir()"))),   create = FALSE,   sep = "/" )

title: Get Normalized Configuration Directory Path of a Program — config_dir
text: app_name Name program/package/app cl_arg Value app specific commandline parameter env_var Value app specific environment variable create whether create returned path, exists yet sep Path separator used Windows

title: Get Normalized Configuration Directory Path of a Program — config_dir
text: Normalized path configuration directory $app_name.

title: Get Normalized Configuration Directory Path of a Program — config_dir
text: following algorithm used determine location configuration directory application $app_name: parameter cl_arg non-empty string, return Else, parameter env_var non-empty string, return Else, environment variable (EV) XDG_CONFIG_HOME exists, return $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/$app_name Else, EV HOME exists, return $HOME/.config/{app_name} Else, EV USERPROFILE exists, return $USERPROFILE/.config/{app_name} Else, return $WD/.config/{app-name} $WD equals current working directory notation $VAR used specify value parameter environment variable VAR.

title: Get Normalized Configuration Directory Path of a Program — config_dir
code: config_dir("myApp") #> [1] "/home/runner/.config/myApp"

what: Get Normalized Configuration File Path of a Program — config_file
title: Get Normalized Configuration File Path of a Program — config_file
text: config_file returns absolute, normalized path configuration file program/package/app based optional app-specific commandline argument, optional app-specific environment variable XDG Base Directory Specification

title: Get Normalized Configuration File Path of a Program — config_file
code: config_file(   app_name,   file_name,   cl_arg = commandArgs()[grep("--config-file", commandArgs()) + 1],   env_var = "",   sep = "/",   copy_dir = norm_path(xdg_config_home(), app_name),   fallback_path = NULL )

title: Get Normalized Configuration File Path of a Program — config_file
text: app_name Name program/package/app file_name Name configuration file cl_arg Value app specific commandline parameter env_var Value app specific environment variable sep Path separator used Windows copy_dir Path directory $fallback_path copied case gets used. fallback_path Value return fallback (see details)

title: Get Normalized Configuration File Path of a Program — config_file
text: Normalized path configuration file $app_name.

title: Get Normalized Configuration File Path of a Program — config_file
text: following algorithm used determine location $file_name: $cl_arg non-empty string, return Else, $env_var non-empty string, return Else, $PWD/.config/$app_name exists, return Else, $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/$app_name/$file_name exists, return Else, $HOME/.config/$app_name/$file_name exists, return Else, $USERPROFILE/.config/$app_name/$file_name exists, return Else, $copy_dir non-empty string $fallback_path path existing file, try copy $fallback_path copy_dir/$file_name return copy_dir/$file_name (Note, case $copy_dir non-valid path, function throw error.) Else, return $fallback_path

title: Get Normalized Configuration File Path of a Program — config_file
code: config_dir("myApp") #> [1] "/home/runner/.config/myApp"

title: Return Corners of Matrix like Objects — corn
text: x matrix like object n number cols/rows corner return

title: Return Corners of Matrix like Objects — corn
Return Corners of Matrix like Objects — corn

what: Get Normalized Data Directory Path of a Program — data_dir
title: Get Normalized Data Directory Path of a Program — data_dir
text: data_dir returns absolute, normalized path data directory program/package/app based optional app-specific commandline argument, optional app-specific environment variable XDG Base Directory Specification

title: Get Normalized Data Directory Path of a Program — data_dir
code: data_dir(   app_name,   cl_arg = commandArgs()[grep("--data-dir", commandArgs()) + 1],   env_var = Sys.getenv(toupper(paste0(app_name, "_DATA_DIR"))),   create = FALSE,   sep = "/" )

title: Get Normalized Data Directory Path of a Program — data_dir
text: app_name Name program/package/app cl_arg Value app specific commandline parameter env_var Value app specific environment variable create whether create returned path, exists yet sep Path separator used Windows

title: Get Normalized Data Directory Path of a Program — data_dir
text: Normalized path data directory $app_name.

title: Get Normalized Data Directory Path of a Program — data_dir
text: following algorithm used determine location data directory application $app_name: parameter $cl_arg non-empty string, return cl_arg Else, parameter $env_var non-empty string, return $env_var Else, environment variable (EV) $XDG_DATA_HOME exists, return $XDG_DATA_HOME/$app_name Else, EV $HOME exists, return $HOME/.local/share/$app_name Else, EV $USERPROFILE exists, return $USERPROFILE/.local/share/$app_name Else, return $WD/.local/share

title: Get Normalized Data Directory Path of a Program — data_dir
code: data_dir("myApp") #> [1] "/home/runner/.local/share/myApp"

what: Return ASCII representation of an R object — dput2
title: Return ASCII representation of an R object — dput2
text: Like classic dput(), instead writing stdout, text representation returned string.

title: Return ASCII representation of an R object — dput2
code: dput2(..., collapse = " ", trim = TRUE)

title: Return ASCII representation of an R object — dput2
text: ... Arguments passed dput(). collapse Character use collapsing lines. trim TRUE, leading trailing whitespace line cleared lines collapsed /returned.

title: Return ASCII representation of an R object — dput2
text: collapse == '\n', character vector length 1. Else, character vector length n, n corresponds number lines outputted classic dput().

title: Return ASCII representation of an R object — dput2
code: # Classic dput prints directly to stdout x <- iris[1, ] dput(x) #> structure(list(Sepal.Length = 5.1, Sepal.Width = 3.5, Petal.Length = 1.4,  #>     Petal.Width = 0.2, Species = structure(1L, levels = c("setosa",  #>     "versicolor", "virginica"), class = "factor")), row.names = 1L, class = "data.frame")  # Traditional formatting using dput2 y <- dput2(x, collapse = "\n", trim = FALSE) cat2(y) #> structure(list(Sepal.Length = 5.1, Sepal.Width = 3.5, Petal.Length = 1.4,  #>     Petal.Width = 0.2, Species = structure(1L, levels = c("setosa",  #>     "versicolor", "virginica"), class = "factor")), row.names = 1L, class = "data.frame")  # Single line formatting z <- dput2(x) cat2(z) #> structure(list(Sepal.Length = 5.1, Sepal.Width = 3.5, Petal.Length = 1.4, Petal.Width = 0.2, Species = structure(1L, levels = c("setosa", "versicolor", "virginica"), class = "factor")), row.names = 1L, class = "data.frame")

title: Test Near Equality — equal
text: Tests whether two objects nearly equal using .equal(). provides readable alternative isTRUE(.equal(x, y)), particularly useful comparing objects length greater one (vectors, lists, data frames, etc.) standard equality operators may behave expected. operator %==% provided shorthand equal(), note operator form accept additional arguments (use function form pass custom tolerance parameters).

title: Test Near Equality — equal
code: equal(x, y, ...)  x %==% y

title: Test Near Equality — equal
text: x, y objects compare ... additional arguments passed .equal(), tolerance control comparison threshold. Uses .equal()'s default tolerance (currently sqrt(.Machine$double.eps)) specified.

title: Test Near Equality — equal
text: TRUE x y nearly equal, FALSE otherwise

title: Test Near Equality — equal
code: # Basic numeric comparisons equal(1.0, 1.0) # TRUE #> [1] TRUE equal(1.0, 1.0 + 1e-9) # TRUE (within default tolerance) #> [1] TRUE equal(1.0, 2.0) # FALSE #> [1] FALSE  # Comparing vectors equal(c(1, 2, 3), c(1, 2, 3)) # TRUE #> [1] TRUE equal(c(1, 2, 3), c(1, 2, 4)) # FALSE #> [1] FALSE  # Using the operator (note: cannot pass custom arguments) 1.0 %==% 1.0 # TRUE #> [1] TRUE 1.0 %==% (1.0 + 1e-9) # TRUE (within default tolerance) #> [1] TRUE c(1, 2, 3) %==% c(1, 2, 3) # TRUE #> [1] TRUE  # Comparing lists equal(list(a = 1, b = 2), list(a = 1, b = 2)) # TRUE #> [1] TRUE equal(list(a = 1, b = 2), list(a = 1, b = 3)) # FALSE #> [1] FALSE  # Special values equal(NA, NA) # TRUE #> [1] TRUE equal(NULL, NULL) # TRUE #> [1] TRUE equal(NaN, NaN) # TRUE #> [1] TRUE equal(Inf, Inf) # TRUE #> [1] TRUE equal(-Inf, -Inf) # TRUE #> [1] TRUE equal(Inf, -Inf) # FALSE #> [1] FALSE  # Pass additional arguments (requires function form) equal(1.0, 1.1, tolerance = 0.2) # TRUE #> [1] TRUE

title: Foreground Color Codes — fg
text: Provides ANSI escape codes named list changing terminal text colors style resetting. codes can modify foreground color reset styles defaults (incl. background color text formatting).

title: Foreground Color Codes — fg
code: fg

title: Foreground Color Codes — fg
text: named list ANSI escape codes text coloring style resetting terminal. Includes colors: GREY, RED, GREEN, YELLOW, BLUE, PURPLE, CYAN, WHITE, RESET default style restoration.

title: Foreground Color Codes — fg
code:
cat(fg$RED, "This text will be red.", fg$RESET, "
") #>  This text will be red.   cat(fg$GREEN, "This text will be green.", fg$RESET, "
") #>  This text will be green.   cat(fg$RESET, "Text back to default.", "
") #>  Text back to default.

title: Find DESCRIPTION File — find_description_file
text: Searches DESCRIPTION file starting current specified directory moving upwards directory hierarchy file found root directory reached.

title: Find DESCRIPTION File — find_description_file
code: find_description_file(start_dir = getwd())

title: Find DESCRIPTION File — find_description_file
text: start_dir starting directory search. Defaults current working directory.

title: Find DESCRIPTION File — find_description_file
text: path DESCRIPTION file found. found, function stops error message.

title: Find DESCRIPTION File — find_description_file
code: # Start search from a specific directory graphics_pkg_dir <- system.file(package = "graphics") find_description_file(graphics_pkg_dir) #> [1] "/opt/R/4.5.2/lib/R/library/graphics/DESCRIPTION"  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Below example will only work if executed from a package directory find_description_file() } # }

what: Get Function Environment as List — function_locals
title: Get Function Environment as List — function_locals
text: Returns function environment list. Raises error called outside function. default, objects specified arguments removed environment.

title: Get Function Environment as List — function_locals
code: function_locals(without = c(), strip_function_args = TRUE)

title: Get Function Environment as List — function_locals
text: without character vector symbols exclude strip_function_args Whether exclude symbols name function arguments

title: Get Function Environment as List — function_locals
text: function environment list

title: Get Function Environment as List — function_locals
text: order symbols returned list arbitrary.

title: Get Function Environment as List — function_locals
code: f <- function(a = 1, b = 2) {     x <- 3     y <- 4     return(function_locals()) } all.equal(setdiff(f(), list(x = 3, y = 4)), list()) #> [1] TRUE

what: Get docstring for a Function — get_docstring
title: Get docstring for a Function — get_docstring
text: roxygen2 package makes possible write documentation R functions directly corresponding function. function can used retrieve full documentation string (docstring).

title: Get docstring for a Function — get_docstring
code: get_docstring(content, func, collapse = TRUE, template = DOCSTRING_TEMPLATE)

title: Get docstring for a Function — get_docstring
text: content R code string. func Name function get docstring . collapse Whether collapse docstring single string. template String return case docstring found.

title: Get docstring for a Function — get_docstring
text: character vector length 1 containing either docstring empty string (case documentation detected).

title: Get docstring for a Function — get_docstring
code:
uri <- system.file("testfiles/funcs.R", package = "toscutil") content <- readLines(uri) func <- "f2" get_docstring(content, func) #> [1] "#' @title Sum of Vector Elements
#' @description f3 returns the sum of all the values present in its arguments.
#' @param b TODO
#' @param a Already documented
#' @export
#' @param z Multiline description
#'
#' of parameter z.
#'
#' @param ... unused
#' @details This is a generic function: methods can be defined for it directly
#' or via the Summary group generic. For this to work properly, the arguments
#' ... should be unnamed, and dispatch is on the first argument.
" get_docstring(content, func, collapse = TRUE) #> [1] "#' @title Sum of Vector Elements
#' @description f3 returns the sum of all the values present in its arguments.
#' @param b TODO
#' @param a Already documented
#' @export
#' @param z Multiline description
#'
#' of parameter z.
#'
#' @param ... unused
#' @details This is a generic function: methods can be defined for it directly
#' or via the Summary group generic. For this to work properly, the arguments
#' ... should be unnamed, and dispatch is on the first argument.
"

what: Get formals of a Function — get_formals

title: Get formals of a Function — get_formals

title: Get formals of a Function — get_formals
text: uri Path R file. content R code string. func Function name. function defined multiple times inside provided file, last occurence considered.

title: Get formals of a Function — get_formals
text: named character vector returned formals().

title: Get formals of a Function — get_formals
code: uri <- system.file("testfiles/funcs.R", package = "toscutil") content <- readLines(uri) func <- "f2" if (requireNamespace("languageserver", quietly = TRUE)) {     get_formals(uri, content, func) } #> $a #>  #>  #> $b #>  #>  #> $x #> [1] 1 #>  #> $... #>  #>

what: Get Documented Functions in a Package — get_pkg_docs
title: Get Documented Functions in a Package — get_pkg_docs

title: Get Documented Functions in a Package — get_pkg_docs
code: get_pkg_docs(pkg = NULL, unload = TRUE, reload = TRUE)

title: Get Documented Functions in a Package — get_pkg_docs
text: pkg package name. NULL, package name inferred DESCRIPTION file current directory parent directory. DESCRIPTION file found, function stops error message. unload Whether try unload potential currently developed package using devtools::unload() checking documentation. Required package loaded devtools::load_all() documentation database exists installed packages. unloading fails, function silently continues, unloading necessary checking documentation currently developed packages. reload Whether reload package using devtools::load_all() checking documentation.

title: Get Documented Functions in a Package — get_pkg_docs
text: Returns dataframe columns title, description, value, examples rows corresponding documented functions package.

title: Get Documented Functions in a Package — get_pkg_docs
code: df <- get_pkg_docs("tools") nchars <- as.data.frame(apply(df, 2, function(col) sapply(col, nchar))) head(nchars) #>                class title description value format examples #> HTMLheader         8    42          71   114      0       53 #> R                  8    35          68   692      0      398 #> Rcmd               8    15          33    30      0        0 #> Rd2HTML            8    15         181   644      0      321 #> Rd2txt_options     8    36          61   154      0      205 #> RdTextFilter       8    25          87   128      0        0 try(df <- check_pkg_docs())

title: Get Project Directory — getpd
code: local({      base_pkg_root_dir <- system.file(package = "base")      base_pkg_R_dir <- file.path(base_pkg_root_dir, "R")      owd <- setwd(base_pkg_R_dir); on.exit(setwd(owd))      getpd() }) #> [1] "/opt/R/4.5.2/lib/R/library/base"

title: Return help for topic — help2
text: Returns help text specified topic formatted either plain text, html latex.

title: Return help for topic — help2
code: help2(topic, format = "text", package = NULL)

title: Return help for topic — help2
text: topic character, topic return help text. See argument topic function help() details. format character, either "text", "html" "latex" package character, package return help text. argument ignored topic specified. Package must attached search list first, e.g. calling library(package).

title: Return help for topic — help2
text: help text specified topic specified format string.

title: Return help for topic — help2
code: htm <- help2("sum", "html") txt <- help2(topic = "sum", format = "text") cat2(txt) #> _S_u_m _o_f _V_e_c_t_o_r _E_l_e_m_e_n_t_s #>  #> _D_e_s_c_r_i_p_t_i_o_n: #>  #>      ‘sum’ returns the sum of all the values present in its arguments. #>  #> _U_s_a_g_e: #>  #>      sum(..., na.rm = FALSE) #>       #> _A_r_g_u_m_e_n_t_s: #>  #>      ...: numeric or complex or logical vectors. #>  #>    na.rm: logical (‘TRUE’ or ‘FALSE’).  Should missing values #>           (including ‘NaN’) be removed? #>  #> _D_e_t_a_i_l_s: #>  #>      This is a generic function: methods can be defined for it directly #>      or via the ‘Summary’ group generic.  For this to work properly, #>      the arguments ‘...’ should be unnamed, and dispatch is on the #>      first argument. #>  #>      If ‘na.rm’ is ‘FALSE’ an ‘NA’ or ‘NaN’ value in any of the #>      arguments will cause a value of ‘NA’ or ‘NaN’ to be returned, #>      otherwise ‘NA’ and ‘NaN’ values are ignored. #>  #>      Logical true values are regarded as one, false values as zero. #>      For historical reasons, ‘NULL’ is accepted and treated as if it #>      were ‘integer(0)’. #>  #>      Loss of accuracy can occur when summing values of different signs: #>      this can even occur for sufficiently long integer inputs if the #>      partial sums would cause integer overflow.  Where possible #>      extended-precision accumulators are used, typically well supported #>      with C99 and newer, but possibly platform-dependent. #>  #> _V_a_l_u_e: #>  #>      The sum.  If all of the ‘...’ arguments are of type integer or #>      logical, then the sum is ‘integer’ when possible and is ‘double’ #>      otherwise.  Integer overflow should no longer happen since R #>      version 3.5.0.  For other argument types it is a length-one #>      numeric (‘double’) or complex vector. #>  #>      *NB:* the sum of an empty set is zero, by definition. #>  #> _S_4 _m_e_t_h_o_d_s: #>  #>      This is part of the S4 ‘Summary’ group generic.  Methods for it #>      must use the signature ‘x, ..., na.rm’. #>  #>      ‘plotmath’ for the use of ‘sum’ in plot annotation. #>  #> _R_e_f_e_r_e_n_c_e_s: #>  #>      Becker, R. A., Chambers, J. M. and Wilks, A. R. (1988) _The New S #>      Language_.  Wadsworth & Brooks/Cole. #>  #> _S_e_e _A_l_s_o: #>  #>      ‘colSums’ for row and column sums. #>  #> _E_x_a_m_p_l_e_s: #>  #>      ## Pass a vector to sum, and it will add the elements together. #>      sum(1:5) #>       #>      ## Pass several numbers to sum, and it also adds the elements. #>      sum(1, 2, 3, 4, 5) #>       #>      ## In fact, you can pass vectors into several arguments, and everything gets added. #>      sum(1:2, 3:5) #>       #>      ## If there are missing values, the sum is unknown, i.e., also missing, .... #>      sum(1:5, NA) #>      ## ... unless  we exclude missing values explicitly: #>      sum(1:5, NA, na.rm = TRUE) #>

title: logf function — logf
text: Prints formatted string optional prefix end string. default prefix grey timestamp default end newline character, useful logging messages. defaults can set globally using options(). details see 'Examples'.

title: logf function — logf
code: logf(   fmt,   ...,   file = .Options$toscutil.logf.file %||% "",   append = .Options$toscutil.logf.append %||% FALSE,   prefix = .Options$toscutil.logf.prefix %||% function() now_ms(usetz = FALSE, color =     fg$GREY),   sep1 = .Options$toscutil.logf.sep1 %||% " ",   sep2 = .Options$toscutil.logf.sep2 %||% "",   end = .Options$toscutil.logf.end %||% "\n" )

title: logf function — logf
text: ... Arguments passed sprintf string formatting. file file() connection object string naming file print . "" (default), output printed STDOUT unless redirected sink(). append Logical. TRUE, output appended file. FALSE, file overwritten. prefix function returning string used prefix. sep1 string used separator prefix formatted string. sep2 string used separator formatted string end. end string used end message.

title: logf function — logf
text: return value. function called side effect printing message.

title: logf function — logf
code: logf("Hello, %s!", "world") #> 2026-02-15 12:09:56.78 Hello, world! logf("Goodbye", prefix = function() "", sep1 = "", end = "!\n") #> Goodbye! local({      opts <- options(toscutil.logf.prefix = function() "LOG:", toscutil.logf.end = "\n")      on.exit(options(opts))      logf("Hello, %s!", "world") }) #> LOG: Hello, world!

what: Get Current Date and Time as String — now
title: Get Current Date and Time as String — now
text: Returns current system time string format YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss[.XX][ TZ]. Square brackets indicate optional parts string, 'XX' stands milliseconds 'TZ' 'Timezone'.

code: now(usetz = TRUE, color = NULL, digits.sec = 0)  now_ms(usetz = TRUE, color = NULL, digits.sec = 2)

title: Get Current Date and Time as String — now
text: usetz Logical, indicating whether include timezone output. color Optional color use timestamp. parameter effective output directed terminal supports color, checked via isatty(stdout()). digits.sec Integer, number digits include seconds. Default 0.

title: Get Current Date and Time as String — now
text: now, current system time string format YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss TZ. now_ms, format YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss.XX TZ, XX represents milliseconds.

title: Stub Function Arguments — stub
text: stub() assigns arguments given function symbols specified environment (usually current environment). arguments without default values, stub() attempt retrieve values .GlobalEnv exist .

title: Stub Function Arguments — stub
code: stub(func, ..., envir = parent.frame())

title: Stub Function Arguments — stub
text: func function arguments stubbed ... non-default arguments func envir environment symbols assigned

title: Stub Function Arguments — stub
text: list symbols assigned envir

title: Stub Function Arguments — stub
text: Stub thought used interactive testing unit testing. work primitive functions. function required arguments without defaults, stub() first check arguments exist .GlobalEnv use values found. enables common dev workflow: (1) Run example code sets variables, (2) Call stub(func), (3) Modify execute parts function body.

title: Stub Function Arguments — stub
code: f <- function(x, y = 2, z = 3) x + y + z args <- stub(f, x = 1) # assigns x = 1, y = 2 and z = 3 to current env #> Created 3 variables in anonymous environment: #>  $ x: num 1 #>  $ y: num 2 #>  $ z: num 3  # stub() can also use values from GlobalEnv for missing args: g <- function(a, b = 10) a + b a <- 5 # Set in GlobalEnv stub(g) # Uses a = 5 from GlobalEnv, assigns a = 5 and b = 10 #> Error in stub(g): argument 'a' is missing, with no default and not found in .GlobalEnv

what: Terminate a non-interactive R Session — sys.exit
title: Terminate a non-interactive R Session — sys.exit
text: Similar python's sys.exit. used interactively, code execution stopped error message, giving provided status code. used non-interactively (e.g. Rscript), code execution stopped silently process exits provided status code.

title: Terminate a non-interactive R Session — sys.exit
code: sys.exit(status = 0)

title: Terminate a non-interactive R Session — sys.exit
text: status exitcode R process

title: Terminate a non-interactive R Session — sys.exit

title: Terminate a non-interactive R Session — sys.exit
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ if (!file.exists("some.file")) {     cat("Error: some.file does not exist.\n", file = stderr())     sys.exit(1) } else if (Sys.getenv("IMPORTANT_ENV") == "") {     cat("Error: IMPORTANT_ENV not set.\n", file = stderr())     sys.exit(2) } else {     cat("Everything good. Starting calculations...")     # ...     cat("Finished with success!")     sys.exit(0) } } # }

what: Traces function calls from a package — trace_package
title: Traces function calls from a package — trace_package
text: Traces function calls package writes file timestamps callstack depth. always used combination untrace_package() untrace package use. example trace_package("graphics"); .exit(untrace_package("graphics"). See examples details.

title: Traces function calls from a package — trace_package
code: trace_package(   pkg,   file = stdout(),   max = Inf,   funign = character(),   opsign = TRUE,   dotign = TRUE,   silent = TRUE,   exitmsg = "exit" )

title: Traces function calls from a package — trace_package
text: pkg Package name trace. file File write . max Maximum depth callstack print. funign Functions ignore. opsign Whether ignore operators. dotign Whether ignore functions starting dot. silent Whether suppress messages. exitmsg Message print function exits.

title: Traces function calls from a package — trace_package
text: return value, called side effects

title: Traces function calls from a package — trace_package
text: function define .exit() handlers option add = FALSE. functions, exit tracing impossible (described trace()). now functions detected ignored manually user using argument funign.

title: Traces function calls from a package — trace_package
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Trace all function from the graphics package, except for `plot.default` # as it defines its own on.exit() handler, i.e. exit tracing is impossible. local({     trace_package("graphics", funign = "plot.default")     on.exit(untrace_package("graphics"), add = TRUE)     plot(1:10) }) } # }

title: Get XDG_CONFIG_HOME — xdg_config_home
text: following algorithm used determine returned path: environment variable (EV) XDG_CONFIG_HOME exists, return value Else, EV HOME exists, return $HOME/.config Else, EV USERPROFILE exists, return $USERPROFILE/.config Else, return $fallback

title: Get XDG_DATA_HOME — xdg_data_home

title: toscutil v2.10.0
text: Added: added functions equal() operator %==% readable equality testing, particularly useful comparing objects length greater one (vectors, lists, data frames, etc.). provide cleaner alternative isTRUE(.equal(x, y)).

title: toscutil v2.9.2
text: stub() now returns invisibly stub() intializes ... NULL present stub() prints compact summary stubbed arguments silenced via options(toscutil.stub.silent = TRUE) testthat now runs multiple cores

title: toscutil v2.9.1
text: Fixed: logf() now correctly uses file append arguments writing output.

title: toscutil v2.9.0
text: Added: stub() now automatically looks missing arguments (without defaults) .GlobalEnv exist . enables common interactive development workflow: run example code sets variables, call stub(func), work function body interactively. Explicit arguments still take precedence GlobalEnv values.

title: toscutil v2.8.1
text: Fixed: unloading devtools get_pkg_docs() (caused check_pkg_docs() fail devtools::load_all() called current session).

title: toscutil v2.8.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-06-28 Added: added functions check_pkg_docs(), find_description_file(), get_pkg_docs(), logf(), read_description_file(), trace_package(), untrace_package() Added: added list fg (foreground colors) Added: arguments color digits.sec functions now() now_ms(). Also merged documentation implementation (now_ms() calls now() internally). Refactor: languageserver now optional dependency instead required one. makes package lightweight easier install. Refactor: catf cat2 implemented efficiently now. particular, use one call cat, makes better usable parallel executed code. Refactor: help2 now also works functions loaded via devtools. Fixed: function named() Fixed: bug function stub(), caused function fail, later arguments used value previous argument inputs.

title: toscutil v2.7.4
text: CRAN release: 2023-09-05 Fixed: Fixed bug cat2 introduced v2.7.3 caused additional newlines added line output.

title: toscutil v2.7.3
text: CRAN release: 2023-08-28 Fixed: using cat2 print files end part kept getting printed console. behavior fixed now end also goes file.

title: toscutil v2.7.2
text: Fixed: Added NEWS.md .Rbuildignore

title: toscutil v2.7.1
text: Fixed: Fixed split_docstring(). Docstrings ending keyword, e.g. @export now returned correctly without additional whitespace.

title: toscutil v2.7.0
text: Added: Added pkgdown website Added: Added functions capture.output2(), dput2(), get_docstring(), get_formals(), update_docstring() Added: Added constant DOCSTRING_TEMPLATE Changed: Improved documentation almost every function Removed: Removed function reference README.md Deprecated: Functions cat0(), catn(), cat0n(), catsn(), catnn(), catfn()

title: toscutil v2.6.0
text: Added: Added function help2 Infrastructure: Added function reference README.md

title: toscutil v2.5.1
text: Fixed: Function .none now also handles atomic vectors length 0, e.g. character(), numeric() logical()

title: toscutil v2.5.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-06-30 Added: Added functions caller, function_locals, locals, now_ms stub Changed: Changed default values function cat2 Changed: Changed return value function now. Timezone returned well, .e. instead "2022-12-24 11:13:57" something like "2022-12-24 11:13:57 CEST" returned. Changed: Added dependencies core packages "methods" "utils" 3rd party package "rlang". Changed: Changed package Title “Utility Functions Tobias Schmidt (ToSc)” “Utility Functions” Fixed: Made function predict.numeric robust (check classes “matrix” “array” now done using function inherits). Deprecated: Deprecated functions cat0, catn, cat0n, catsn catnn

title: toscutil v2.4.0
text: Added: Added functions config_dir, data_dir, norm_path, config_file, xdg_data_home, xdg_config_home,

title: toscutil v2.3.0
text: Added: Added functions catsn, catnn, catf catfn

title: toscutil v2.2.0
text: Added: Added function home

title: toscutil v2.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-02-22 Infrastructure: Added details package functionality implemented methods field Description file DESCRIPTION Fixed: Replaced F FALSE getfd.{R|Rd} Fixed: Updated function documentation. Every function now contains least following roxygen tags: name, title, description, return, .e., corresponding *.Rd-files contain least following tags \name, \title , \value, \description. Added: Argument end cat variants

title: toscutil v2.0.3
text: Infrastructure: Added files generated CRAN submission

title: toscutil v2.0.2
text: Fixed: Improved .Rbuildignore

title: toscutil v2.0.1
text: Fixed: Removed man folder .gitignore Fixed: Changed License entry DESCRIPTION MIT + file LICENSE prevent R CMD check note Fixed: Made repo public prevent invalid URL note R CMD check Fixed: Converted title DESCRIPTION title case prevent R CMD check note

title: toscutil v2.0.0
text: Removed: cache function, downstream dependencies caused problems R CMD check Fixed: Documentation cat0, catn, cat0n Fixed: Documentation ifthen Fixed: Documentation rm_all Changed: predict.numeric use paste instead glue::glue remove dependency package glue

text: Fixed: filename ./R/named.R (file extensions missing) Infrastructure: migrated gitlab github Infrastructure: added github action R CMD check.

text: Added: function sys.exit(status)

text: Added: cat0, catn cat0n functions
